text: It just seems pointlessAt   I m doing significantly better than many of my friends at least according to societal standards I m regularly told I m talented at work  I live on my own  I m financially stable  and from a career perspective I m on a fast track to advancement Yet I m still depressed  both my parents have a drinks problem in fact it s why I barely talk to my mother  My father is in AA and when I started to notice I was binge drinking at   I stopped yet I ve been drinking these last few weeks very heavily I ve been depressed my whole life but over the last few years I ve been dealing with my emotions fairly healthily meditation  poetry  and exercise they give me a way to force myself to deal with my emotions and my drinking was replaced with smoking weed on the weekends But recently I ve been wondering  does it matter  and having read Buddhist texts I found the answer was  no  and I was ok with that  We grind forward day after day and in all truth all the little things we worry about don t really matter  I know that  none of my small issues with work or my struggles with my personal life or lack there of are of any importance yet recently it s all been tearing at me as if it s all life or death The slightest issues at work now ruin my week feelings of constant loneliness tear me down every day and the only escape from it is a particular affectionate black cat who I love but doesn t seem like the strongest support network I ve considered therapy yet I worry I can t afford it  I ve thought perhaps it s time to look at dating more seriously but being dependent on another person for my happiness doesn t strike me as a good idea Perhaps I already know the answer to my problems but honestly I can t even tell you the question  I m not sure why I wrote this I doubt I ll actually commit suicide my father and friends would blame themselves I can t do that to them  I apologize for wasting your time
summary: Both of his parents have a drink problem. His father is in AA. He has been drinking heavily recently. He is depressed and lonely. He doesn't want to go to therapy as he can't afford it. He's considering dating.

text: Take it from someone who s been there This is not a cry for help  This is a message of hope I have suffered with extreme social anxiety and moderate depression for most of my life  It used to be really bad  I first attempted suicide in seventh grade  Throughout the majority of my adolescence I have had one or more plans kicking around in my head as to how I would finish myself off  I hated school  I hated my life  but most of all i hated myself  There were weeks where I couldn t stand the sight of myself in a mirror  and would avoid them obsessively to spare myself the sight of the massive walking failure I had become Last year was my breaking point  I couldn t take it any longer  This time I promised myself would be my LAST time  I had all the supplies ready  my note written  and nothing to lose  I was lying on my bedroom floor ready to suffocate myself But something happened before I made that final decision  Somewhere in me was a part of me that didn t want to die   That Saturday I broke down to my mom  For a good forty five minutes I let the floodgates open  She finally got to know her son as he saw himself  She got me counseling  someone I could express my darkest thoughts to and who would help me overcome them  They got me on an antidepressant  I can honestly say that he saved my life And things have gotten better  I have gone a full year without suicidal thoughts   I am more outgoing and less anxious  and at long last I finally love myself  I am living proof that whatever is going on in your life it can  and  will  get better if you talk to someone about what you  are going through  Don t be afraid  There are people out there who love you and who will be more than willing to help you if you take that first step and tell them you need it   I am FullClockworkOddessy  I am a suicide survivor  And I m here for you
summary: FullClockworkOddessy has suffered with extreme social anxiety and moderate depression for most of his life. He first attempted suicide in seventh grade. His mom talked him out of it and got him counseling and he was put on an antidepressant. Now he is more outgoing and less anxious.
cleaned: fullclockworkoddessy suffer extreme social anxiety moderate depression life attempt suicide seventh grade mon talk get counselling antidepressant outgoing anxious

text: Post grad depressionHi   I ve been feeling awful for a little over a month and need advice and someone to tell me it ll be okay So  this May I graduated with a Bs in Physics  I was very burnt out  and decided to take a job as an analyst for retirement pensions  While I m glad I got a job out the gate and am able to make student loan payments in the grace period  the job is not for me  It s such a boring subject to analyze  I freaked out when I realized I didn t like this job because I as so ready to like and take it and now the plan has changed  I ve been applying to jobs more in my field and I ve gotten one shitty phone interview  I ve also been applying to grad school for engineering   Basically  I feel really lost and hopeless  I feel like I ll never get out of this terrible small city where I can t even be out and proud with my girlfriend  this breaks my heart every fucking day  and I m miserable   I m scared of accruing more student debt and I m scared of the future  I m scared I ll never get to where I m going and I ll be at my job forever  I m feeling a little suicidal   I hate this part of growing up  no one ever told me how hard being a college graduate is  Can someone give advice and or tell me it s ok   Thanks for reading this

text: I don t like my friends Recently I ve been finding that my friends are falling into   categories    They are unmotivated  never reach out  only respond in one word answers all the time  and force me to carry the conversations  Most in this category have adopted depression as their personality and it s just boring being around them      I have nothing in common with them  and am only friends with them because we went to   go to the same school  They aren t ideal friends or even any friends that I would want  The only reason I ever talked to them was to get through the day  Other than that  I m happy being strangers      Politically different  Not much to be said here  All they care about is echo chambering their political ideologies with one another to the point where their conversations are repetitive and just annoying  When I want to discuss something different or mildly disagree with them  I m just excluded from the conversation and nearly kicked out of my own social circle   I just hate these dynamics so much and I don t want to be friends with any of these people anymore  I want to leave them in the past  but I have nowhere to go  All of this was highlighted by quarantine  but reflecting on this  it s always been this way  I just needed them more before  Now for once I m stable enough to not rely on them  but at the same time  total social isolation right now seems like a bad idea  I don t know what to do
summary: I don't like my friends. I have nothing in common with them and I'm only friends with them because we went to the same school. I want to leave them in the past but I don't know what to do.
